name: Mount Katahdin

current_conditions.ai_summary: The ultimate challenge in Maine features exposed ridgelines and the famous Knife Edge. Expect strenuous scrambling and rapidly changing alpine weather.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing as the northern terminus of the Appalachian Trail, Katahdin offers a spiritual and rugged ascent through the heart of the Maine wilderness. The view from Baxter Peak sweeps across the Hundred-Mile Wilderness, offering a pristine tapestry of lakes and granite.

The Challenge

This is a severe physical undertaking requiring upper body strength for the Hunt Trail's boulders or nerves of steel for the Knife Edge. Hikers must ascend over 4,000 feet of elevation gain in a single day.

Local Insight

Parking reservations at Baxter State Park are mandatory and sell out months in advance; arrive at the gate by 6:00 AM if you have a spot.

trails_config.name: Hunt Trail (Appalachian Trail)
trails_config.description: The official AT route, featuring the terrifying yet exhilarating climb up the Gateway boulders.

ui_alert.title: Baxter Park Reservation
ui_alert.message: You strictly cannot enter the trailhead parking without a DQR (Day Use Parking Reservation).

ui_alert.message: You strictly cannot enter the trailhead parking without a DQR (Day Use Parking Reservation).
